content: Would I be able to coerce a compiler team member to propose https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/79361 for stabilization perhaps? (or also tell me I'm doing the wrong thing and to follow a different process)
I think typically what we would do is FCP a PR that changes the option from being unstable to stable.
I suppose adding the flag originally never went through the modern MCP process but the flag itself seems fairly uncontroversial to me.
There is work being done to support split dwarf. I guess the same flag can be used on macOS to control of dsymutil should be run.
Ok thanks @Wesley Wiser! I'll send a PR soon
Yeah, much like @bjorn3 suggests it seems to me like it might make more sense as a part of a more general mechanism to control split debuginfo
I'd actually kind of want a -C split-debuginfo for maximum generality in flag naming.
then it can have various values like =off, =on, =dsymutil, =builtin etc.
a bit of a belated follow-up, but I've posted this with the -Csplit-debuginfo suggestion as https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/79570
